channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AK

item.title: Report X-2025040837
item.description:
Report X-2025040837

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-09T12:25:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-11
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 11th during the AM sort a package was discovered that appears to have leaking contents and a strong odor. the box was marked as ID8000 consumer Commodity, 9. The package was opened and inside was a retail box holding a bottle of perfume. The perfume bottle broke allowing the entire contents to leak out. The shipper was contacted and the packaging was placed into a salvage drum to be disposed of.

item.title: Report X-2025040657
item.description:
Report X-2025040657

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-07T21:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-03
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/3/2025 at approximately 1330 hours, Dangerous Goods Administration received notification of undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of 2 fiberboard boxes, each contained multiple bottles of perfume. AWB# 772715499316 had 22 bottles of perfume and AWB 772787929150 had 19 bottles of perfume. Customs intercepted the shipment for further investigation, which confirmed the presence of the perfume. Neither shipment was prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, as it did not display the required markings, labeling, packaging, or paperwork. Customs has requested that the shipments be destroyed.

item.title: Report X-2025040658
item.description:
Report X-2025040658

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-07T21:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-03
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/3/2025 at approximately 1230 hours, Dangerous Goods Administration received notification of undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of 50 bottles: 5@70ml, 3@75ml, 32@100ml, 3@125ml, 4@120ml, & 3@80ml. Customs intercepted the shipment for further investigation, which confirmed suspicions of undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, missing the required markings, labeling, packaging, and paperwork. The shipment was refused at entry and Customs has requested disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025040400
item.description:
Report X-2025040400

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-07T21:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-31
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE DUE TO THE RATTLE SOUND OF AEROSOL CANS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED AN INNER BOX WITH A GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARK. THIS INNER BOX CONTAINED TWELVE AEROSOL CANS OF FLAMMABLE GUNK ENGINE DEGREASER ORIGINAL, EACH AT 15 OZ CAPACITY. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER W963C6, AMAZON DAP, 1 WATERVIEW RD, ISLAND PARK NY 11588-2298. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING GROUND TO ALASKA RATE SERVICE WHICH MUST TRANSPORT IN THE AIR NETWORK TO ALASKAK. THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN SDF TO ANC.

THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER W963C6, AMAZON DAP, 1 WATERVIEW RD, ISLAND PARK NY 11588-2298. item.title: Report X-2025040173
item.description:
Report X-2025040173

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-07T21:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-26
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 3/26/2025 at approximately 1400 hours, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 261690 at the ramp facility in Anchorage, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. This report covers 4 different shipments from the same shipper. Each package contains several bottles of perfume and cologne. The shipments were flagged by Customs under the suspicion of potentially containing undeclared dangerous goods. Further investigation confirmed these suspicions. The packages were not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, as they did not display the required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork. All shipments are being held, pending an investigation by the FAA.

  • Description: one of two packages containing Lithium Ion batteries discovered smoking on sorting belt. package was removed and taken outside to a secured area and caught fire. Report filed with NRC. affected shipment secured in salvage drum pending disposal. Incident Report # 1426321
